Package blackminer37.cannonballer

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackminer37.cannonballer.Timer
  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0.0 This keeps track of the information of a Timer. The timer can be used to keep track of the time since it was started, or to keep track of a duration of time.
    Author:
    BlackMiner37

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Timer()
      This is the main constructor for the Timer class.
      Timer​(int durationInSeconds)
      This is the Timer constructor that sets the duration time.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getCurrentTimeMillis()
      This returns the difference between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC in milliseconds.
      int getCurrentTimeSeconds()
      This returns the difference between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC in seconds.
      java.lang.String getFormattedDurationTime()
      This returns the duration of the timer in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
      java.lang.String getFormattedStartTime()
      This returns the time that the timer was started in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
      java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromAdjustedStart()
      This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active, minus the time paused, in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
      java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromGivenTime​(int miliSeconds)
      This returns the difference in time between the given parameter and the current time in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
      java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromStart()
      This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
      int getPauseTimeInSeconds()
      This returns the amount of seconds that the timer has been paused.
      int getPauseTimeMillis()
      This returns the amount of milliseconds that the timer has been paused.
      int getStartTime()
      This returns the time in milliseconds that the timer was started.
      int getTimeFromAdjustedStart()
      This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active, minus the time paused, in milliseconds.
      int getTimeFromStart()
      This returns the amount of time that the timer has been running in milliseconds.
      int getTimeFromStartInSeconds()
      This returns the amount of time that the timer has been running in seconds.
      boolean isPastDuration()
      This checks the current time with the timer duration and returns if the current time is past or not.
      boolean isPaused()
      This returns if the timer is currently paused or not.
      void pause()
      This pauses the timer at the current time.
      void resetDuration()
      This resets the duration of the timer with the duration that was used when the timer was initiated.
      void resetDuration​(int durationInSeconds)
      This resets the duration of the timer with the given parameter.
      void resume()
      This resumes the timer from the point when it was paused

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer()
        This is the main constructor for the Timer class. This will start a timer at the current time.

      • Timer

        public Timer​(int durationInSeconds)
        This is the Timer constructor that sets the duration time. The given parameter will set the duration of the timer. This will start a timer at the current time.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - The amount of time in seconds that the duration will be set to.

    • Method Detail

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This pauses the timer at the current time.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        This returns if the timer is currently paused or not.
        Returns:
        isPaused Boolean

      • resume

        public void resume()
        This resumes the timer from the point when it was paused

      • resetDuration

        public void resetDuration()
        This resets the duration of the timer with the duration that was used when the timer was initiated.

      • resetDuration

        public void resetDuration​(int durationInSeconds)
        This resets the duration of the timer with the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - The time in seconds that the duration will be reset to.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getTimeFromStart

        public int getTimeFromStart()

      • getTimeFromStartInSeconds

        public int getTimeFromStartInSeconds()

      • getFormattedTimeFromStart

        public java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromStart()
        This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
        Returns:
        formattedTimeFromStart String

      • getFormattedTimeFromGivenTime

        public java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromGivenTime​(int miliSeconds)
        This returns the difference in time between the given parameter and the current time in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
        Parameters:
        miliSeconds - The time to be compared with in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        formattedTimeFromGivenTime String

      • getTimeFromAdjustedStart

        public int getTimeFromAdjustedStart()
        This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active, minus the time paused, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        adjustedTimeFromStart Integer

      • getFormattedTimeFromAdjustedStart

        public java.lang.String getFormattedTimeFromAdjustedStart()
        This returns the amount of time that the timer has been active, minus the time paused, in the standard American clock format (HH:MM:SS).
        Returns:
        formattedAdjustedTimeFromStart String

      • getCurrentTimeMillis

        public int getCurrentTimeMillis()
        This returns the difference between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC in milliseconds.
        Returns:

      • getCurrentTimeSeconds

        public int getCurrentTimeSeconds()
        This returns the difference between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC in seconds.
        Returns:
        currentTimeSeconds Integer

      • getPauseTimeMillis

        public int getPauseTimeMillis()
        This returns the amount of milliseconds that the timer has been paused. This only updates after the timer has been resumed.
        Returns:
        pauseTimeInMilliseconds Integer

      • getPauseTimeInSeconds

        public int getPauseTimeInSeconds()
        This returns the amount of seconds that the timer has been paused. This only updates after the timer has been resumed.
        Returns:
        pauseTimeInSeconds Integer

      • isPastDuration

        public boolean isPastDuration()
        This checks the current time with the timer duration and returns if the current time is past or not.
        Returns:
        pastDuration Boolean
